category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: D6.1 Report on best policy practices
result.description: A short report highlighting the most relevant and promising examples of Nordic best practice replicable in the Baltic context, as showcased during the study visit and reflected upon during the follow-up workshops. The report will also feature practices from wider Europe. Focus will be on case studies that promote successful cross-sectoral collaboration and integration of ecosystem structures and resources to advance social innovation.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Methodological guidelines & training programme for the Living labs in 9 countries and online training resource how to lead socio-ecological LLs for women
result.description: Drawing on the Green Deal and the EU Farm to Fork Strategy both of which promote sustainable socio-ecological transitions in agriculture and rural areas, 9 GRASS CEILING living labs will be created in 9 partner countries to support existing and potential rural women innovators in developing their innovator identity, co-create knowledge within an innovator network, and progress rural socio-ecological transition through green innovation skill development. In- and cross- country knowledge and resource sharing are embedded in the lab network structure.

result.title: Impact Assessment Report - Final Version
result.description: This deliverable will report in detail the final achievement on the processes of change effectuating the socio-economic, environmental and cultural impact of the CENTRINNO approach, employing qualitative and quantitative data from different project resources, including (indicatively):-WP2: material flow analysis data (e.g., volume of urban waste; new biomaterials generated; new urban mining activities/processes created; number of stakeholders mapped/connected), Emotion Networking sessions (e.g., number of stories documented in the Living Archive; participants in offline exhibitions; number of heritage spaces regenerated)-WP3: tool usage data (e.g., local challenges addressed; urban stakeholders integrating/taking up tools in their operations; number of FCH tools replicated; number of local community members participating in FCH co-creation; number of new projects/collaborations/networks initiated)-WP4 and WP6: pilots events and activities reporting (e.g., number of participants in events; professionals/citizens participating in trainings; number of new products/business ventures prototyped/designed; new job opportunities created)Among the processes of change, the deliverable will also assess how each Fab City Hub contributes to the urban regeneration processes of their pilot city
